content: yarn needle a hook and scissors if you find a knot cut the knot out and rejoin the yarn with this method 1 thread one yarn end onto the needle then insert the needle into the same piece of yarn about an inch back from the needle 2 weave the needle back and forth through the yarn a few times splitting the yarn in half as you poke the needle through insert your hook into the loop closest to the eye of the needle so you don t lose this loop 3 pull the needle through keeping the loop on the hook 7 4 thread the other yarn end onto your needle and pass the needle through the loop on your hook as soon as you get the needle into the loop you can remove the hook so it s out of the way 5 weave the needle back and forth through the new piece of yarn a few times and pull it through 6 trim the ends pinch and roll the join in your fingertips to smooth it out then continue crocheting still having trouble check out tamara kelly s video tutorials on her excellent crochet blog moogly she shows how to hold the yarn and hook how to make a slipknot how to make a chain and how to double_crochet http //www mooglyblog com/learn-how-to-crochet/ left handed video http //www mooglyblog width you can make a wider blanket for a queen- or king-sized bed by increasing the number of stitches in the first row using a 4 mm hook this stitch pattern creates 3 25 stitches per inch and about 2
